Package com.github.oeuvres.alix.util

Class IntIntMap

java.lang.Object
com.github.oeuvres.alix.util.IntIntMap
All Implemented Interfaces:
Cloneable
public class IntIntMap extends Object implements Cloneable
An efficient int-int Map implementation, encoded in a long array for key and value. A special method is used to modify a value by addition. Used for word vectors indexed by int. Be careful, do not use -2147483648 as a key (Integer.MIN_VALUE), is used to tag empty value, no warning will be sent. source: http://java-performance.info/implementing-world-fastest-java-int-to-int-hash-map/

    • next

      public boolean next()
      Iterate throw data to go to next entry Jump empty cells, set entry by reference.
      Returns:
      false if end of sequence, true otherwise.

    • put

      public int put(int key, int value)
      Like Map.put(Object, Object). Associates the specified value with the specified key in this map. If the map previously contained a mapping for the key, the specified value replaced the previous value, the previous value is returned.
      Parameters:
      key - to associate with value.
      value - associated with key.
      Returns:
      previous value associated with key, or Integer.MIN_VALUE if there was no mapping for key.

    • put

      public IntIntMap put(int[] data)
      Put an array of values, index in array is the key.
      Parameters:
      data - data[key] = value.
      Returns:
      this.

    • put

      public IntIntMap put(int[] data, int value, int size)
      Put an array of keys, fill with a default value.
      Parameters:
      data - [key1, key2…] array on int used as keys
      value - Default value for all keys.
      size - The amount of data to put.
      Returns:
      this.

    • remove

      public int remove(int key)
      Remove an entry, like Map.remove(Object).
      Parameters:
      key - of the entry to remove from map.
      Returns:
      previous value associated with key, or Integer.MIN_VALUE if there was no mapping for key.

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Reset Iterator, start at -1 so that we know that pointer is not set on first valid entry (remember, a hash may have lots of empty cells and will not start at 0)

    • set

      public void set(int value)
      Use after next(), set current entry by iterator.
      Parameters:
      value - new value to associate with current key.

    • size

      public int size()
      Like Map.size(). Returns the number of key-value mappings in this map.
      Returns:
      Count of key-value mappings in this map.

    • toArray

      public IntIntMap.Entry[] toArray()
      Output (key, value) entries as an array.
      Returns:
      (key, value) entries array.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      A String view of the vector, thought for efficiency to decode Usage of a DataOutputStream has been excluded, a text format is preferred to a binary format A space separated of key:value pair 2:4 6:2 14:4
